website_summaries.verdict: The TP-Link AC3150 Wireless MU-MIMO Gigabit Router Archer C3150 is a well-equipped dual-band router that delivers speedy file transfers and gives you a wide assortment of management settings.

customer_reviews.title: 5GHZ issue!! DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: I work from home, and this TP LINK AC3150 that i got a year ago has been a serious HEADACHE!!!!!!!!!! No security and no firmware update for this version since 07/06/2016!! UNBELIEVABLE! THERE IS A SERIOUS ISSUE WITH 5GHZ DISCONNECTING every one to THREE days, and sometimes DAILY!! I was Factory Resetting this device every three to four weeks!!!! This was my THIRD TP LINK product and I seriously loved them but after the LACK of support I got, and the uncaring attitude of TP LINK in general, I will NEVER EVER buy another one!! I WILL AVOID TP LINK AND TO AVOID ANY ISSUES from loss of connection, PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: LuvAndroid36

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a year and absolutely terrible customer support.
customer_reviews.text: Router worked flawlessly for about 1 year. Then one day the wi-fi signal began to disappear. I would unplug the router and plug it back in and it would work for a few more days. I submitted a request with TP-Link two weeks ago, no response. I called their tech support number today and after waiting on hold for 20 minutes they said hello and hung up on me. I have currently been waiting on live chat for over an hour for someone to respond. TP-Link customer support is terrible. I will not purchase another product from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Garbage - worked for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this router in June 2016. It was easy to set up and we got great speeds from it. Then, just 6 months later in December, it randomly stopped working. The router is stuck in a constant reboot loop and nothing will stop it. I have unplugged and replugged several times, making sure to allow plenty of time in between. I tried connecting via ethernet but the router doesn't stay on long enough for my computer to access it. Now there is no option to return or exchange and Amazon says the item is not eligible for support. After only 6 months?? Will not be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great performance
customer_reviews.text: Update: Tp-link customer service came through and provided a replacement router in only a few days. New unit has been working great for a few months now with zero issues. I continue to be a huge Tp-link fan, also using their powerline adapters, cable modem and a gigabit switch. Wireless worked for about six hours after set up and crapped out. Multiple resets, firmware, tech support to no avail. TP Link customer service is a bit challenging but they are helpful and processing my return. Will update after I get the replacement. On the positive side it was easy to set up and worked great while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Coverage was so-so, and reliability is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: For a new $200 router, I expected more. The speed was very good when it worked, the coverage could have been better (my previous $100 router had better signal), but the multiple resets and times when nothing could get it to work again have just been too frequent and frustrating, so I'm throwing in the towel. There were just too many times that I needed it and it was on the blink. Customer service was not very helpful, and I can't see myself buying another TP-Link product in the future.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Failed after only 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 1 year. Just recently it started flashing all lights after being on for about 2 hours. If I restart it, it works fine for a little while, but about 2 hours later it's not working again. Disappointing for what I paid. There was no storm associated with the sudden partial failure, and for what it's worth, this device and the cable modem were protected with lighting/surge protection on the AC and cable lines. This is the second TP-Link routed I've had fail prematurely (other failure was a different model). I'm going to start using another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Give It To Mikey

customer_reviews.title: two failed in less than two years
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these TP Link AC3150 routers that have both failed in less than two years. Tech support replaced the first one, but they are refusing to replace the second since it was replaced under warranty and they require proof of purchase within two years... the replacement is less than two years old and still failed. WiFI became intermittent and signal drops.
customer_reviews.author: MetalMan

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: We had so many issues with our net last year, it was insane. We replaced routers and modems and upgraded to a higher speed, and nothing worked. Finally, we had Spectrum (formerly Time Warner) actually physically come out and replace the cable wire that hadn't been maintained since the last owners had it installed...which was YEARS ago. Internet came back with a force. This router made it incredibly easy to see what was going on with our net and who was doing what with their devices (not any sort of Big Brother stuff, just general download speed/activity times and such). We haven't had any drops since installing this, at least not to any fault of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Never had an issue, supports dozens of devices easily
customer_reviews.text: Have never had to manually reboot this router. I share internet with my neighbor, who lives 2 units over and 1 unit up. And he gets great signal. So on a typical night, they were will be several devices using internet at the same time with no router issues: 1 Roku, 1 Chromecast, 2 Nests, 2 iPhones, 2 iPads, 1 Android phone, 1 Android tablet, and 2 laptops. Now, Comcast internet may lag a little, but the router can always keep up. Have not used the FTP hard drive support yet, but I plan to.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D

customer_reviews.title: Not stable
customer_reviews.text: For the first one of these I had the 5G broadcast failed. I replaced the unit with a new unit (under the 1-month time limit for returns). The second unit performed well until it suddenly stopped (outside the time limit for return). I tried a number of things. If I tipped the unit just right, occasionally the power would come on, but it wouldn't stay on. I don't recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: William B. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great product with nice extended features!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good... fast, reliable with great range when paired with the appropriate WiFi adapters on your peripherals.The added functionality of being able to connect an external USB 3.0 storage device to it's USB 3.0 port is terrific for sharing all types of files using it's built in SAMBA/SMB server. When paired with the TP-Link AC1900 Wireless adapter I use on my Windows 10 Pro desktop system, Samba throughput was a respectable 30-50 Mbytes/sec depending on the amount and size of the files being transferred; large, single files being the fastest. It's USB 2.0 port can function as a print server when a printer is attached. These are very useful added functions.
customer_reviews.author: ghudson58

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a few months, then died
customer_reviews.text: I received this on 21 February 2017, configured it, and it worked great until 07 May 2017. The day it stopped working, I noticed several devices could not connect to it, but a few still could. After some attempts at figuring our what was going wrong, I rebooted the device and it never came back online again. I see the power light come on but nothing else and I can't ping the router. So this was a pretty big waste of money. I'd recommend steering clear of this product based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: randomdude1978

customer_reviews.title: Great router when working, but ver.1 will not last
customer_reviews.text: I bought the TP-Link AC3150 ver.1 router in mid-June 2016 and it no longer works as of Sept 17, 2017. When it worked, it was great. Unfortunately, I experienced the same issues others have mentioned about the router dropping certain WiFi devices and not allowing them to reconnect. This started to happen a few days prior. After testing all other pieces of equipment it came down to the AC3150 router. After resetting the router, all internet connections were lost & the internet icon was orange. Knowing my internet & modem were working, I tried down loading the latest firmware update. Unfortunately this did not help and the router does not function properly after only 15 months.
customer_reviews.author: RED

customer_reviews.title: Greats - work with 9 different products at the same time without loss
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router because I have 3 cell phone, 3 tablets, 3 desktops, and one laptop. This router allows me to designate which tablet,computer or phone used the 2G ro 5G signal. I have all the phones and tablets online and downloading andriod updates (6) each and the phone and tablet finish within 10 seconds of each other and 2 phones (5x & 6P) at the same time before the others. Great product. Did have one question and call their support line and talked with a tech and got an answer within 2 minutes and several very helpful suggestions that make the system work smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to get this wifi router and if it wasn't for 1 flaw, it would have been a great router. The strength of the signal was great, it reached farther than any other router I've owned and covered my entire house. My main issue is that it kept dropping my 5 ghz band at least twice a day. Worked with tech support 3 times and got no results for fixing the issue. Standard answer was checking to see if the latest firmware was on it (was out of the box), change channel, reset the router, and reboot it. So this router is getting shipped back and I'll find one that doesn't have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Klepper

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Operating very well. No problems what so ever in the last 6mo of ownership. Love the network attached storage feature and friendly user interface. While my living area where this router is installed is pretty small, I've installed other TP_link routers in bigger homes and have gotten great signal even in distant rooms. I'm currently getting about 50MB/s write and 80-100MB/s read from a wired Ethernet connection to the USB3.0 network attached HDD, but I believe the slower speed is attributed to the HDD and its enclosure, not the router.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. W. John

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer support
customer_reviews.text: Product failed 9 months out of warranty, which is based on build date. Not purchase date, will not be purchasing anything from TP-Link or their Kasa line. Customer service was abhorrent, while I can sympathize with the gentlemen on the other end of the phone, I trouble shooted as much as possible to no avail, the suggestion of their representative was to replace the product, again, 9 months out of their "build date" warranty. Would give zero stars for zero help.
customer_reviews.author: Craig M.

customer_reviews.title: You will regret your purchase when you have to call customer service
customer_reviews.text: updated: 01/15/2018 This product was great while it was working but it died suddenly (power light flashing continuously) so I called customer service since my device is still under warranty. . let me tell you...everything people are saying about TP link customer service is true. They are terrible. I have been trying to get a case number so i can replace my device for the past 15 hours (no exaggeration) . and they are just giving me the run around. I would not recommend them to anyone and will never buy their products again. previous review (5 stars) amazing product. signal reliability everything is great. very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: IK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it’s just that interfaces are getting simpler but I was really impressed with how easy this router was to set up compared to the last several routers I have had. Kudos to the TP-Link software people. It’s a new purchase but it works fine with a good signal that carries to all the areas in our vacation getaway — and then some! If it lives a long life I’ll be a happy customer. :-)
customer_reviews.author: P. Pazucha

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price compared to similar other brands
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding router. I had a notable increase in wifi speed and signal strength/range. Would have no problem recommending this product to friends/family. Great product for the price compared to similar other brands. The only problem I found was it listed no username/password for setup via a wireless connection. I had to connect wired first, then change the password for wireless. Other products I've had in the past I've been able to setup via the wireless connection. Outside of that, very easy setup process. Love the QoS features offered at this price point. Most other products that offer QoS are in the $250+ price point range.
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Routastic....
customer_reviews.text: Got this from a third party and I must say it is a pretty great router.,...so far....was set up wireless signals are pretty strong and the management system is simple. Had a headache setting up my old motorola system. And it's a nice looking device... Not into the heavier,explanation of modulating network traffic...its only myself and my wife but there are 14+ devices that are randomly on and off the network and no issues with sharing bandwidth. Seller dis wonders shipping it...looked professional and was shipped timely...
customer_reviews.author: Mo headphones

customer_reviews.title: A great router for your home networking needs
customer_reviews.text: Great router! Totally worth the money, especially with the dual-band wifi channels. My phone, laptop, and game streaming devices have never worked so well! We use a lot of bandwidth in my house between the video streaming, gaming, and general internet use and this router has definitely been up to the task. Most nights my wife and I will have 2 laptops, 2 phones, Netflix streaming, and possibly a game system as going at once and this router handles all of those devices like a champ. Don't settle for the crappy ISP router, upgrade to a better option like this one!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want to do a software reset every week. (Hardware reset makes things worse somehow??!!)
customer_reviews.text: I will avoid TP-Link moving forward due to this router. I have bought a lot of their smart plugs and bulbs, tolerated errant behavior due to the newness, but this router locks up/ slows to a crawl every week, which cannot be tolerated. First "high-end" router I bought, guess its back to my Rosewill!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a few months then began sporadically dropping out
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few months then began sporadically dropping out. Will not connect for longer than 10 minutes now. Can’t return or get support from the seller because I bought it 6 months ago. Tried calling TP support line, can’t get anyone who speaks English.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Fiorello-Heggem

customer_reviews.title: ... roommate moved in that was also a heavy gamer like myself. Our previous one struggled to provide quality ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product about two months ago after a new roommate moved in that was also a heavy gamer like myself. Our previous one struggled to provide quality wifi service to both rooms in a small two bedroom apartment - something that didn't seem like it should be too tough. Once we got this set up, we have all been enjoying full coverage and at faster speeds! We had been hesitating to buy one since it was a bit pricey, but we caught an Amazon sale on it and we are so glad we did! I'll post an update in a few months, as our previous one started out great but declined over time. Los Angeles based with Spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan G

customer_reviews.title: it works, it's fast
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It has built in support for OpenVPN, and is incredibly easy to set up. OVPN on dd-wrt is a hassle, this thing is press a button and the keys are generated for you. The wifi is fast, I'm using it to connect two Roku tv's, an amazon firestick 4k, and two cell phones. It works flawlessly. Gigabit ethernet works properly. Cons: there is no dd-wrt build for it at all at the time of writing. Not a big deal for me though.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit, if you are sent the latest revision.
customer_reviews.text: Many of us bought this router on promises of new features brought via firmware update. What we weren't told was that the new features would only be available on the v2 release. Be careful buying this router - if you want the features, verify you are getting a v2 before finalizing your purchase or you'll have a $200 piece of abandonware on your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Glenn

customer_reviews.title: It worked well while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: It worked well while it lasted, but less than a year after using it, this router has started giving connectivity issues. For how expensive it is, it should be lasting much longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Kolobow

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it, but it's a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well at first. But now I have to reboot it almost once a day because my speeds fall to under 3 MBps when I should be getting closer to 100 MBps, and that is even wired. Remove this and speeds are exactly what I expect. Add to that the random wifi drops and this is just a horrid router. Waste of money because now I have to purchase a replacement. Barely made a year.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The quick setup manual is easy to follow. I had it up and running in 30 minutes. The dual bands is a must if you have older devices that only connects to 2.4 G like I do. You can fine tune security features, and being able to plug in a network drive to it is something I never knew I needed. The through put speed and latency improved a t thousand fold compared to my old Linksys N300 - or was it N30? I threw away that thing so quickly that it's already a distant memory.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: It's much better than the one it replaced
customer_reviews.text: This router puts a powerful signal throughout our 2000-square-foot house. It's much better than the one it replaced. My only complaint, a small one, is that I've found no way to connect devices online. I have to use the WPS button on the router. That button is conveniently located on the side of the router, and it's not something one has to do often. All in all, I'm delighted with this router and recommend it highly. EDITED - There is a WPS provision within the accessible functions. I just had to hunt for it.
customer_reviews.author: Widescreen guy

customer_reviews.title: Fixed wi-fi connectivity issues and made a noticable speed difference
customer_reviews.text: Has made a tremendous difference in device speed. We have over 15 devices regularly connected to the wireless ans outgrew our old router. This sits in the basement and is able to provide coverage especially in places where we had issues of dropping before (Fixed my issue with remote Roku sticks dropping off the wi-fi). I dropped a star because out of the box it was buggy due to the firmware. Had some issues getting the correct firmware to update and installed on the router. Once it was updated, the problems disappeared and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A Rockstar among routers
customer_reviews.text: This router is simply awesome! I'm not going to bore you with a bunch of technical info, but will tell you how may devices are most times on at the same time: 1 or 2 laptops 2 Kindle Fires 2 or 3 T.V.'s streaming (Netflix, Hulu, etc.) I sometimes livestream video, and do not get buffering even when up to 6 other devices are being used. The range is excellent. I live on the 1st floor of a 2 flat with a full basement, approximately in the middle of a 90 long home, and signal strength is very good. Easy to use interface as well.
customer_reviews.author: PK606

customer_reviews.title: Good router! Firmware feels like in BETA Version!!
customer_reviews.text: This router is really good I like the UI design and features, but my main concern is that the factory firmware still has a long way to go and not sure how frequently firmware updates will be released as I'm currently facing an issue with USB sharing via FTP where the developers added <<folderName>>(sda5/1).. not sure why they added the volume name as part of folder name. NOTE: TP-LINK NO MORE SUPPORTS DD-WRT.
customer_reviews.author: R. Veluvali

customer_reviews.title: Strong, consistent, reliable signal
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Highly recommended, exceeds my expectations. With a previous generation of equipment, I was going down in the basement to reset the router several times a week. I have had this for 10 months and I think I have reset it 3 times. We are running multiple smart phones, tablets, laptops, a refrigerator with an internet touchscreen, a RING PRO video doorbell, and netflix/hulu, and it all runs great, all the time. One of my better purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Dorky Dad

customer_reviews.title: It's been running 24x7 for 3 years without a glitch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router for a small business I support, they have 20 PCs and IP phones on their LAN and this router has handled the task flawlessly for years now. For the price paid, I am amazed at how well it works and how reliable it has been.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I had a tech support issue. They responded relatively quickly, and their troubleshooting steps were actually reasonable. The problem wasn't the router, so 5 stars for a fully functioning router + fully functioning tech support. The user interface is simple enough that I think I only used the manual for the default login/password to get started. It does everything I wanted DD-WRT to do, except it's way easier and it's not riddled with bugs that they'll fix eventually maybe.
customer_reviews.author: madcow3417

customer_reviews.title: OK While It Lasted.
customer_reviews.text: Was ok while it lasted, stopped working after little more than one year. It's supposed to have a two year warranty but regardless of this fact I had to purchase a new router as it is needed for my home security system. So, IF TP-Link honors their warranty I'll have a second otherwise unneeded/unwanted spare router.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Di

customer_reviews.title: Performance that lives up to the specs
customer_reviews.text: While I have considerable technical knowledge, this review is entirely from a consumer viewpoint. I have not measured the various specifications, but tested thoroughly in my home network. It covers my covers my 1500 sq ft home with Netflix streaming, and cellular wifi without any hitches. i especially like the easily accessible wifi on/off buttons on the side. Spec-wise, it is excellent, and have no reason to doubt its performance when pushed to the limits. My previous router was from TP-Link - am highly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: TomT

customer_reviews.title: I'm good with this product
customer_reviews.text: I'm nowhere near a computer geek so I did run into a few issues getting it to work. Still, I haven't figure out how to connect my printer to all my pc's. HP was of no help at all. All these little set back's tend's to make me read and learn a little more. I'm not worried, I'm sure that the 27/7 customer service will be there to help me out.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C. Hardeman

customer_reviews.title: Solid, affordable.
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking at getting the most out of your high speed internet and have a/c devices you'll be pleasantly surprised with the performance of this router. I was able to pull full bandwidth 231Mbps from my ISP OVER the WiFi. Sending files to NAS is a snap, and the network is beautiful, the nice thing about 5ghz if you're in an apartment complex you're out of the radio interference for the most part. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Car Guru

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders
customer_reviews.text: Has majorly improved our online play. We run two PS4s at once, and with our Charter provided hardware we experienced frequent latency when playing Overwatch at the same time, and sometimes even if only one was being used because so many electronics are online in our house at once. This has made a significant difference. While we do run into the occasional voice lag, we haven't had a problem with the game being unplayable since installing this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy King

customer_reviews.title: Warning - Network Drops Out Nightly
customer_reviews.text: Product has great power and a two year warranty but there is no support. Calling 24/7 support line does no good. Phone just rings and rings and ring and then hangs up. I have a TP Link 1750 router and it works great but this AC3150 drops every networked computer off of the network every night. You can still access the internet but you have to reboot every computer on the network to re-initialize it on the network so you can print or share files. So if you enjoy rebooting all household computer every day then purchase this router.
customer_reviews.author: Russell L.

customer_reviews.title: misleading
customer_reviews.text: The router was used did not come in original box or with any manufacturer documents. In my router search and reviews I never included used in my request and was not aware the router was not going to be new. I am being given a refund but feel used electronics or other merchandise should not be listed with new items unless the customer specifically request to see used items
customer_reviews.author: John2nd

customer_reviews.title: Worst Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: While the router worked, it was great. After 5 or 6 months it stopped working. TP-Link was sent me a replacement, but it was a 150N modem, not this product. I've been going back-and-forth with them for weeks and can't get the right people on the phone. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: B. Piehler

customer_reviews.title: We'll see....over time.
customer_reviews.text: I've been running this for 2 days now. Did the initial setup, no problems, everything went as stated....did the speed test wired, and all is fine; did wireless and getting between 50 - 80% of wired speed. Tried various settings and only really tested the 2.4n mode....so far, every device does not give full wireless speed. Connection is solid though, and range is decent. Will continue to check over time with different wireless devices, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Pra

customer_reviews.title: Cheap for a reason. 2 failures in 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this router. The 2nd one I've had in 6 months has just started failing just like the first. Amazon was gracious enough to replace the first one after it started flaking out around the 30 day point. This replacement has lasted around 4.5 months and now needs to be reset twice a day in order to run even close to correctly. Spend a little more and get a quality product. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Mask

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 Ghz does not stay connected and will not allow me to connect again
customer_reviews.text: The 2.4 Ghz network on the router I purchased won't stay active. I connect multiple computers to it and eventually(Usually in 24 hours) they all lose connection. I have tried changing channels and channel width. I tried removing profiles on multiple computers (Mac and PC). Nothing has worked. I have been in contact with Support and they have not been able to solve the issue. The previous 2.4Ghz router I had did not have this issue. The 5 Ghz seemed to be rock solid and the anything using the ethernet was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy J Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Was the router an over-kill? Probably.
customer_reviews.text: I had a wifi-modem combo from Charter. I had constant problems. I upgraded to a dedicated Modem and a dedicated Wifi Router. Night and day. No more problems. Was the router an over-kill? Probably. With tech, the best only lasts until something new is available. I seen this at a great prices on TP-Link on Deals of the Day. You can never go wrong with having the Best.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: Very excellent
customer_reviews.text: It is such a perfect router, I can connect as much as I want of devices at the same time without worrying about the signal or the speed.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Mohammad_Mahmoud

customer_reviews.title: Worst router I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I've been a power user of networking technologies since the days of 2400 baud modems, and this is hands down the worst router I've owned. It has glaring issues in many areas - stuff doesn't work, UI sucks, basic functions are missing, etc. Getting it to honor DHCP reservations is a pain. There is no way to disconnect users from the router's web interface. Updating the firmware wipes all settings without warning you that it'll do that, and it does it even when the firmware doesn't need to be updated (doh). Basically I would avoid this router in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have this located on a second story, and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this located on a second story, and I went from never receiving a signal in the basement to now getting 4 bars. We usually have 3 wireless connections going at most times, which is 2 video streams and 1 video game console, and none of them lag. The price is definitely justifiable.
customer_reviews.author: jeremyc9

customer_reviews.title: Works great for multiple device househould
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install and works well. We have 5 children and MANY devices in our house--this has completely eliminated the lag in games and streaming video that we were previously experiencing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mouser

customer_reviews.title: Stay away...Not a good value at the cost, better options
customer_reviews.text: Didnt last 2 years. Warranty sucks. They finally replaced with refurbished unit with day 90 coverage. There are better, cheaper options...Or look at the mesh technology.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Pecan Rancher

customer_reviews.title: Update, router slowly dying!
customer_reviews.text: Overall just Ok...when you get several kids playing minecraft or games it slows down everything, not up to par with newer models, very disappointed with the router. **Update, randomly disconnects devices, also now drops, 2.4g Network daily, having to reboot router 1-2x a day. Today it started disconnecting 5g as well. Really bad, 1 year and dying!
customer_reviews.author: David Denver

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a little over a year ago but did not use it until 13 days ago. This afternoon, it quit completely and is defective. I called tech support and they confirmed that is it defective but can't do anything because it is "over a year old" even though I can prove it has been unused until 13 days ago. I will never purchase another TP-Link product again. Terrible product and service. Don't waste your money on this $150.00 paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Pricy but impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Simply outstanding! A bit pricey but after 1 week very impressed. My home is over 3800 sq ft on 3 levels. Great coverage with router on level one at one end of the home do to connection to cable. Very strong signal in all locations. Setup was very easy if connecting to an existing modem that is already installed in network do not forget to clear browser. Connection to TP Link app was easy and gives flexibility in setup. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Pack

customer_reviews.title: one minor issue so far.
customer_reviews.text: Installed one in a business today and had the strangest thing happen - after installation and verified both 2g and 5g were working, I turned off 'guest access' all of a sudden all nobody could log into 2g anymore. It kept refusing the password - 5g with the same password worked fine. I turned guest back on and 2g is now accepting the password. I've never seen this before.
customer_reviews.author: computerguy

customer_reviews.title: Bricked
customer_reviews.text: On the first firmware update from their website BRICKED.. 3 lights 2 white 1 red and will not change at all..
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase for home
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Our house is shaped liked a rectangle. It can get 4 out of 5 bars on our phone at the other end of our house (2,000 sq ft). Before we used a cheap wifi and extender and still could not get this coverage. Love being able to use an app on my phone to customize and set passwords. We also run a ton of stuff from phones, iPads, computers, Netflix. Still has consistent speed without drops.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Incredible coverage and speed!
customer_reviews.text: Great router! I have a house with a little over 3000 sq feet and I now get full house coverage! My previous modem/router only allowed me to get about 30mb download speed. I now get over 100mb download anywhere in my house wirelessly! I have one desktop computer hardwired to the router and get the full download speed of about 115mb. To get over 100mb wirelessly in my house on my iPhone, iPad and laptop is fantastic! Best electronic purchase I have made in a long time!!!
customer_reviews.author: A Smith

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link C3150
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the last 5 months and now my devices are having trouble connecting. I am constantly having to reboot the router to get devices to connect. Tried everything and still having the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J Gale

customer_reviews.title: This router is awesome and immediately doubled my home wifi
customer_reviews.text: This router is awesome and immediately doubled my home wifi. My home is also fairly large and it extends to the whole house, which is very nice. The old router had trouble with both of these items. The interface for the router is also very simple and its very easy to set up. Great router overall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_PRO_123

customer_reviews.title: Great dual wireless router takes the load off the router my ISP provided
customer_reviews.text: I use this router for web TV and security cameras. It works perfectly. It of course had to be tuned and put in the right place in the house. Its not a toaster you don't just plug it in and no matter where you put it it works perfectly you have to figure out the optimal spot and the proper antennae angles. I also have a router from my ISP so I had to make sure they didn't conflict. For that I used ping-tools pro on my android phone to optimize the setup.
customer_reviews.author: Franticcity

customer_reviews.title: Better than Linksys
customer_reviews.text: Better than Linksys! I took a bit longer complete the initial setup. The speed is amazing. We use 12+ devices and we have not notice any issues with the connectiosn or speed. The security fetures are a plus and upgrading was very fast. The GUI can be used by all levels of expertice (none, novice, and advanced). The parental control can be setup as blacklist or whitlist. I can also stop any devices by MAC. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: 5g not strong enought.
customer_reviews.text: 2.4 works great. 5 is not strong enough signal. wifi no, have to use cables. 2.4 wifi is fine. may send it back. No sure.
customer_reviews.author: RanD

customer_reviews.title: This router worked very well for about a month. ...
customer_reviews.text: This router worked very well for about a month. Then today, I uploaded new firmware, and the router just quit. I cannot reset it and I cannot communicate with it in any way. I sent an email to support and only got an automated reponse asking me to check on the website. I cannot get into the website as it doesn't send me a password reset as requested. Further, I called tech support and just got a busy signal. I have had previous tp-link routers that worked well but this one appears to have problems and support appears to be hard to get.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S.

customer_reviews.title: Good router.  Would not configure as Access Point
customer_reviews.text: I have used other TP Link wireless routers successfully, but this model was impossible to configure as an Access Point behind another router which is what I needed, even though the instructions said it would work as an AP. I would not buy it if you need an Access Point to put behind another router.
customer_reviews.author: W. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pick for anyone looking to upgrade their wi-fi
customer_reviews.text: Super easy setup in less than 60 seconds assigning the SSID to match our old router so all our devices would auto-connect. This was a long overdue upgrade from our old 750MBps dual band Belkin that was locking up when all four people in the house tried using the Internet with phones, computers, games, or TV's. The TP-Link software is very intuitive and I think the 3150MBps dual band will give us plenty of speed until we see the next technology bump since it has more capacity than the ISP can provide to the house.
customer_reviews.author: 20artworks05

customer_reviews.title: Bandwidth Control!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement of the same model. Unfortunately, the wan port died on the previous one. What I really like about this particular model is the bandwidth control feature, which allows me to allocate precious bandwidth of either individual IP address or group of ip addresses. TP-Link has moved away from such feature on newer models.
customer_reviews.author: Everly Pangilinan

customer_reviews.title: I bought this router just over a year ago and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router just over a year ago and it is currently on its way back to the manufacturer for the second time. I spent $200 on this router and it is junk. Every 6 months I have to have it replaced. I have had the same cable modem/router that i hook to this one for 5 - 6 years and no problems, it was less than half as much as this one cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Powers

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link works for me
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic router when used with an exceptional service provider. When you have service with WOW, you get service like a sine wave on an oscilloscope. This router gets the signal to all rooms of my house without using a booster, For the price I paid then was well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: GrandPa in the Panhandle

customer_reviews.title: This is the Amazon choice and it deserves the rating ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the Amazon choice and it deserves the rating. This is also my 4th wifi router and by far the top performer (no more linksys connection issues for me). All my devices connected quickly the first time without fail and stay connected. I regularly test my xfinity download speeds at 220+.
customer_reviews.author: flip

customer_reviews.title: worse in my 4600 sq
customer_reviews.text: Range was very disappointing, worse in my 4600 sq. ft. house than my 1-year old Netgear Nighthawk AC1900. Speed was nice, but with bad range, pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: Sophy Wang

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This router kicks some serious butt. It's super easy to set up, and hasn't given us any problems since we plugged it in. It's been through several power outages and not even so much as a hiccup from this guy. This router is well worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kline

customer_reviews.title: Over all great, but had a glitch and TP-LINK took care of me quick.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, super fast and really stable on 5ghz, but after 2 months the 2.5ghz band just stopped working at all. Still gave it a 3 star, because 5 ghz worked great and TP-LINK's tech support was awesome. They worked with me to figure out one of the bands was dead and sent a replacement very quickly. Internet was never down because 5 ghz was working great, so not a big deal. Will definitely buy TP-LINK in the future. Dropped frame rates by 18 fps. Super fast and has a very big range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link AC3150 "Please configure your DNS Manually"
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 9 months then randomly started throwing a DNS error ("Please configure your DNS Manually") one day and would not connect to internet through modem. Tried all the troubleshooting steps from TP-Link and internet to no avail. Had to eventually use an old router to handle IP addresses and this as an access point. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant router. Made my network and Wi-Fi SOOOO much ...
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant router. Made my network and Wi-Fi SOOOO much faster. Easy to setup. Practically begs to be setup in your home. Read someone's note that installing the updates could cause glitches in WiFi schedule, which I found to be true. Easy to install updates, easy to roll them back. Thing works like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Powereful, reliable hard wired and wi-fi router.  Designed for MANY simultaneous devices and high speed video.
customer_reviews.text: This router is powerful and very fast compared to my older (failed) NetGear router. I alter from hardwired to wi-fi often and this router lets me easily turn off my wi-fi when I am not using it (push button switch). I have attached two ROKU devices and many simultaneous computers and have tested them all both hard wired and wi-fi and performance is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gary Cotterill

customer_reviews.title: We have had very good luck with this wireless router
customer_reviews.text: We have had very good luck with this wireless router. It seems to have good power/distance, and has been reliable for us. The ability to provide wireless printing is *much* more appreciated than I would have expected. The 5g network can't reach all the way to the opposite side of the house, but the 2.4g network can w/o any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Professor

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Product is fast and gives a good signal. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Ankrum

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Product started out great. Easy setup. Worked less than a year, tech support through manufacturer is a joke. After over an hour on hold, tried chat, after 50 minutes waiting, sent email. Didn't get a response for over 6 hours and all they did was tell me to try the reset instructions I had already tried. Now it's over 24 hours later and I still do not have a working router or information on repair or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk do no buy
customer_reviews.text: This was my second one purchased that failed with a month of purchase. Their customer service is a joke. Take my advise and do not buy a TP-Link brand.
customer_reviews.author: brian k

customer_reviews.title: You'll love it for 3-months; then it's a brick.
customer_reviews.text: Like many of the other reviews - worked great for the first 4 months; Now i have to re-boot it 1 or 2 times per day for the WIFI connection. My ethernet connected laptop and desktops are over 230 mbps - via speedtest.net; wifi is reading at 1 mbps....if you can get it to connect at all. Reboot router...great connection...for a few hours; then gone again. Researching my next router, but guaranteed it won't be TP-Link. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Don’t upgrade firmware. It bricked my device twice. Support is garbage and tells you to reset the device after 10 minutes with no response.
customer_reviews.author: Anon.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a year. 8 months for me.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 8 months, then just died. Very disappointed. Don’t know how I chose such a bad product. Always read the single star reviews. I must have forgot. Most said it died between 6 and 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Free Shipping

customer_reviews.title: 5g channel doesn't hold a very good signal. have to keep resetting
customer_reviews.text: 2.5g channel doesn't hold a very good signal . have to keep resetting it
customer_reviews.author: donald james

customer_reviews.title: Lacking a couple of options I would like to have seen.
customer_reviews.text: The unit is slick. Wi-Fi on my devices did not show a significant speed increase over the unit it was replacing. I have deducted one star because unlike many of its counterparts, it cannot be set into Wireless Access Point mode. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 6mo, no customer support
customer_reviews.text: Dead after 6mo first went the 5Ghz band then 2.4ghz, now only wired lan works. Even after factory reset and checking if there was a firmware upgrade, there wasn't. Impossible to get a hold of support. Never buying TP-Link again
customer_reviews.author: SomeRandomPerson

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link AC3150
customer_reviews.text: Night and day as compared with my old Netgear router which inexplicably would drop all wireless connections and have to be frequently rebooted. The range as well was increased by a large margin. The initial setup and the router menus were pretty straight forward. The tech support for my initial problem concerning a shared printer was swift and responsive. This is my first router from this company and I was a bit conservative therefore did not purchase the top of the line this time, but will if this one starts to get overloaded by the addition of IP wireless devices. I have used this router for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Techangles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Wi Fi booster
customer_reviews.text: Awesomeness we live out in country an had to install Hughes Net Internet and had no wi fi signal to even use phones or Xbox, an we kept being told we had strong signal, which come to find out, after buying this we do😁😀😄so happy for me😍my Christmas present to myself 😄😄😄
customer_reviews.author: moosewatcher

customer_reviews.title: Not for Mac
customer_reviews.text: GREAT Wi-Fi penetration and speed. VERY difficult to set up compared with Linksys routers. WiFi works well, network cabling works with Windows 10 but NOT with iMac (ElCapitan OS). I may send it back. Tech support was useless and hard to understand (overseas accent).
customer_reviews.author: Alvin C. Lustie

customer_reviews.title: worth the price easiliy.
customer_reviews.text: now have internet throughout the house without problems. The other routers I had would not reach the bedrooms, but this one does without an issue. Easy to install as well. Just sad that I bought extenders for the other routers before buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Peebles

customer_reviews.title: Save a hundred dollars,buy this one
customer_reviews.text: Bought four name brand routers one hundred more each.Did not meet expectations.I had to pass through my house to a house guest 30' away with concrete block wall construction !This worked!Maybe even overkill,but still a hundred bucks less .Also not as invasive ,respects privacy.Linksys,Netrgear,Asus want your life history!Very Good Product.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: NEVER WORKED
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE PRODUCT!! ERROR 9805 seems that is a hardware problem!! Had it on as a secondary option and NEVER worked! Tried to figure out what happened nowadays and on the web search seems its hardware! TP LINK never more!
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Castanheira

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly with very easy setup. It has three power levels; I use the medium level for my whole house and about 20 feet outside. It does B,G, and N. The wireless speed is enough to play HD movies on a TV two rooms away. It is my best router to date.
customer_reviews.author: StephenR

customer_reviews.title: Good router, love it
customer_reviews.text: Good router, love it. After using the router for one year and it went down, but TPLink replaced the unit for free in just few days. Their service is good too. Will buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Liang

customer_reviews.title: FAST delivery of a good product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this about 1:00PM on Thursday and it was ready for pickup at 7:10 AM on Friday at my Post Office. Easy set up, excellent features and very good coverage.
customer_reviews.author: MARK

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed-  UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: As fast as it died, it came back. Not sure what to make of this! Well, was great while it worked. We've had it a little over 2 months and it just stopped working. No warning, no nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad but I was looking for perfect local and internet connections - and router can support more devices
customer_reviews.text: Keep missing pings in Local network and on internet. So end up returning it. Also told by tp-link devices max can be supported is 25. I had more devices than that connected to router. Not Bad but I was looking for perfect local and internet connections - and router can support more devices
customer_reviews.author: R. Kapur

product_meta.title: TP-Link AC3150 Wireless Wi-Fi Gigabit Router (Archer C3150 V1)
product_meta.description:
AC3150 WIRELESS WIFI MU-MIMO GIGABIT ROUTER (ARCHER C3150)
GET FASTER WIFI FOR EVERY DEVICE

MAKING INCREDIBLE SPEED A REALITY
With combined speeds of up to 3150Mbps, the Archer C3150 easily handles demanding activities at the same time. The router uses the latest innovations in WiFi technology to create a faster, stronger, more reliable wireless network for your home. With the Archer C3150, lag, dropped connections, and dead zones will become a thing of the past.


NITROQAM AND 4-STREAM FOR MAXIMUM WI-FI SPEED
The Archer C3150 boasts a powerful combination of advanced Broadcom NitroQAM technology and 4-Stream technology, which boosts wireless speeds up by 25%. This provides the speed and elite performance that you need to support your most demanding online applications, including simultaneous 4K streaming and online gaming.


MORE CONNECTIONS AND MORE SPEED FOR EVERYONE
The Archer C3150 does more than just create faster WiFi, it helps your devices achieve optimal performance by making communication more efficient. With MU-MIMO ready* technology, the Archer C3150 can provide four simultaneous data streams, allowing all connected devices to achieve speeds up to 4X faster than standard AC routers. Moreover, dynamic Smart Connect technology automatically selects the best available band for each device.


EXTRAORDINARY HOME ENTERTAINMENT
Archer C3150 can support many devices when you invite friends to your large house to entertain. It can maintain multiple simultaneous HD streaming, online gaming and other content consumption without lag. The Archer C3150 can provide a maximized coverage and enable your devices to stay covered, near or far as it. Don’t let your mobile lifestyle stop the streaming and enjoy your home party.


THE POWER AT THE HEART OF YOUR ROUTER
Unlike normal routers, which usually have single core processors, the Archer C3150 features a powerful 1.4GHz dual core processor. This unlocks the full potential of NitroQAM and 4-Stream technologies, helping your dual band router maximize its performance potential.


COVERAGE FOR YOUR ENTIRE HOME
Four high-performance dual band antennas and high-powered amplifiers help create a strong, far-reaching network for your home. Beamforming technology focuses the WiFi transmission in the direction of your connected devices, concentrating the signal where you need it the most. This allows you to enjoy fast, stable WiFi in every part of your home, as well as on the patio, by the pool, and even in the yard.


A ROUTER YOU CAN SHOW OFF
An elegant, minimalist design allows the Archer C3150 to be integrated seamlessly into the decor of any room. The LED indicators can be switched off to prevent distraction at night when placed in bedrooms or common spaces.


PLUG INTO SHARING, PLUG INTO STABILITY
You can quickly and easily share photos, music, and other files with family and friends. Just connect an external hard drive to the Archer C3150’s USB 3.0 port or USB 2.0 port and immediately start enjoying lightning-fasttransfers. To help your wired devices reach peak performance for smooth gaming and streaming, you can also create fast, stable wired connections using the four Gigabit Ethernet ports, which transfer data at speeds up to 10x higher than standard Ethernet ports.


EASY SETUP AND USE
Whether you prefer the powerful Tether App or the intuitive web interface, you can set up your Archer C3150 in minutes. The Tether App allows you to manage network settings, including parental controls and media sharing preferences, from any Android or iOS device.


OTHER FEATURES INCLUDE:
GUEST NETWORK
 * Provide a separate Wi-Fi network for visitors and guests

PARENTAL CONTROLS
 * Manage when and how connected devices can access the Internet

VPN SERVER
 * Setup a secure connection between your private networks to the Internet

ADVANCED SECURITY
 * Utilize WPA/WPA2 encryption for active defense against security threats
feature_bullets: Sytem Requirements:Subscription with an Internet Service Provider (for Internet access)
AC3150 with 4-Stream and NitroQAM technology delivers up to 3150Mbps Wi-Fi speeds over dual 2.4GHz (1000Mbps) and 5GHz (2167Mbps) bands
Smart Connect helps devices run faster by intelligently assigning them to the best available connection
Enjoy 4K HD video and play online games simultaneously with faster Wi-Fi to all your devices without interruption with powerful 1.4GHz dual-core CPU and 2 co-processors
Lightning-Fast wired connections using four Gigabit Ethernet Ports
Send targeted Wi-Fi signal to individual devices with beamforming

specifications.Operating System: Microsoft Windows 98SE, NT, 2000, XP, Vista or Windows 7, Windows 8/8.1/10
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars806 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
